head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #9

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #9 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on Board the Schooner Nancy whilst at Amherstburg & Moy in the month of August 1813[.]
Six of the hands employed on board the Ship Detroit getting in her masts – no duty done on board[.]
Fore part of this day men still employed at the Detroit – at 2 PM they leave off with the Detroit having got in all her masts, at 4 PM get under weigh for Moy, with a pleasant breeze at Sou[th.]
At day light Came too at Moy & moored to the Wharff – no duty done on board the rest of the day[.]
These three days under orders for Long point – hear of the arrival of our Fleet at Amherstburg[.]
At 7 AM unmoored from Moy wharff for Amherstburg at 6 PM arrive at Amherstburg, fresh breezes at intervals of this day from the Southwards[.]

Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday & Wednesday. [T]he men are employed at the Detroit at the request of Genl Proctor – the last-day Capt Berkley made application to me for the men to go on board the Detroit, which I told him was out of my powers to do, but if the men chose to volunteer for a trip I had no objections, to which he replyed that as the Vessel was in goverment employ, it was equally the same if the men were taken out & others put in their stead, (which were to have been Canadians from other Vessels –) for the Season to which I ansd I could not do so, he then said in presence of Lieut Troughton "he had no further service for me & that I might go off" – my men Continued to work until 4 PM & then retd on board the Nancy[.] Settled my provisions with the Commissary up to this day – the 18th[.]

At 11 AM sailed from Amherstburg for Moy, fresh breezes at South & clear pleasant weather at 3 PM arrive at Moy moored to the wharff at 5 PM Recd a letter from B: Genl Proctor, saying that the Nancy was wanted to go to Makinac to transport provisions, & stores, – latter part of the day nothing done on board[.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
